reviews.review_text:
Food was really good, we had ordered kingfish thali, chonak thali, butter chicken, Paratha and lemon drinks.. the fish size was really big and tasty and worth the try.. i would give it 5/5 on food.. they also serve alcohol.

The only pain was their service, we had ordered 6 chonak and one kingfish thali and they prepared it vice versa.. the waiter came to ask of we were fine to have 5 kingfish thalis but when we denied he readily and politely agreed to rectify their mistake.. but very soon another waiter arrived with kingfish thalis and he had no clue.. so their internal communication was little off...we had ordered one lemon drink without sugar but even that was missed..

Overall food is awesome.. just waiters need to communicate internally better..

This place is close to the highway with lot of parking area. There are many steps to climb to the restaurant so it is little difficult for aged members. We visited this place on 1 June 2024 for lunch. We tried the Goan chonak and modso thali with vellyo rawa fry. The thali consisted of rice, prawn curry, bhindi bhaji, one piece of fish, kismoor, shevyo, sol kadi, salad, pickle and papad. I was disappointed with the salad served in the thali as it was all cut cabbage and one piece of carrot. However, the fried fish in the thali was fresh. The sweet in the thali was tasteless. The vellyo fry  was not that fresh but had a little better salad with some tomato and onion pieces. I found the thali a little expensive for the quality and quantity. The service was so slow that we had to wait for an hour till the food arrived. The staff is not welcoming at all.

Service: 1.0
â€¢ Location: 2.5
â€¢ Hotel highlights: Place with many tables, quite and breezy.
â€¢ Walkability: 1minute walk from main road.
â€¢ Food & drinks:  Fine

Valley View Restaurant and Bar It is conveniently located across from the highway, where you will find the best seafood here.
People do come over to this place to have their various dishes,and it never disappoints them.
It is one of the best restaurants to visit in Goa and enjoy your various cuisines.
Goa is famous for its natural beauty, where people enjoy the weather anytime they come over to chill.
The restaurant has an amazing atmosphere with natural views just like the forest around it and cool vibes to enjoy together with friends and family. It tends to make you feel like having your meal with greenery all around you and also enjoy it while sharing your thoughts and love.
It has ample parking space as well for all vehicles.
The place is big enough to enjoy the natural view as they have an amazing ground beside the restaurant that makes it a little eye-catching to watch.
The restaurant has an outdoor seating area that is quiet and warm as well.
We tried out king fish (king mackerel). In spite of the fish being masala fried, you could specifically taste the fish.
Now you would be surprised to know why I said so. I have tried out many fish dishes where they just have a taste of masala, but this fish had a perfect blend of Indian spices on the fish and tasted yummy. The squid was delicious.
Another surprise was that we got 4 slices of beautiful fish and it just cost us Rs.400, whereas it would cost you around Rs.1000+ in Mumbai.
The taste of the food is really awesome, and you should definitely try out their seafood menu.
The service staff were really nice and interactive. I enjoyed spending time at this restaurant.

Overall rating :- 3.2ðŸŒŸ
